sentences.sentence: When he came to the sea, the water was purple and dark blue and gray and thick, and not green and yellow as before. And he stood and said,
“Precious( 珍稀的 ) magic fish,
Greatest of all fishes!
What I would not wish
My wife, Isabel, wishes.”
“Now then, what does she want?” said the fish.
“Oh,” said the man, half frightened( 害怕的 ), “she wants to live in a large stone castle( 城堡 ).”
“Go home, she is already standing in front of the door,” said the fish.
Then the man went home, but when he got there, instead of the cottage( 小别墅 ) there was a great castle of stone.
His wife was standing on the steps, about to go in.
So she took him by the hand, and said,
“Let us enter.”
With that he went in with her, and in the castle was a great hall with a marble( 大理石 ) floor.
There were a great many servants, who led them through large doors.
The passages were decorated( 装饰 ) with tapestries( 织锦 ), and the rooms were furnished( 布置家具 ) with golden chairs and tables.
Crystal( 水晶 ) chandeliers( 枝形吊灯 ) hung from the ceiling( 天花板 ), and all the rooms had beautiful carpets( 地毯 ).
The tables were covered with delicious foods and rare( 稀有的 ) and expensive wines.
Behind the castle was a stable( 马厩 ) with many fine horses and carriages.

There was also a splendid( 绝妙的 ) large garden with the most beautiful flowers and fine fruit trees, a large grassy park with deer( 鹿 ) and cows and sheep, and everything that the heart could wish for.
“There!” said the wife. “Isn’t this beautiful?”
“Oh yes,” said the man, “we can live in this fine castle from now on, and be very happy.”
“We will see about that,” said the wife. “In the meanwhile( 与此同时 ) we will sleep upon it.”
With that they went to bed.
The next morning the wife woke up first, just at sunrise( 日出 ).
She looked out and saw from her bed the beautiful country all around.
The man took no notice of it, so she poked( 捅 ) him in the side with her elbow( 肘部 ), and said,
“Husband, get up and just look out of the window.
Just think if you could be the King of all this country.
Just go to your fish and tell him you should like to be King.”
“Now, wife,” said the man, “what should I be a king for? I don’t want to be a king.”
“Well,” said the wife, “if you don’t want to be a king, I will be the Queen.”
“Wife,” said the man, “what do you want to be Queen for? I could not ask him such a thing.”
“Why not?” said the wife. “You must go directly all the same; I must be the Queen.”
So the man went, very much upset( 心烦意乱的 ) that his wife should want to be Queen.
“It is not the right thing to do—not at all the right thing,” thought the man.
He did not at all want to go, and yet he went anyway.
And when he came to the sea the water was quite dark gray, and rushed far inland( 向内陆 ), and had a disgusting( 令人作呕的 ) smell. And he stood and said,
“Precious magic fish,
Greatest of all fishes!
What I would not wish
My wife, Isabel, wishes.”
“Now then, what does she want?” said the fish.
“Oh dear!” said the man, “she wants to be Queen.”
“Go home, she is Queen already,” said the fish.
So the man went back, and as he came to the castle he saw it was very much larger, and had great towers and splendid( 壮观的 ) gates.
Guards stood before the door, and many soldiers( 士兵 ) with drums( 鼓 ) and trumpets( 号角 ).
And when he came inside everything was of marble and gold, and there were many curtains( 窗帘 ) with great golden tassels( 流苏 ).
Then he went through the doors into the great hall, and there was his wife sitting upon a throne( 王座 ) of gold and diamonds( 钻石 ), and she had a great golden crown( 皇冠 ).
So the man went up to her and said,
“Well, wife, so now you are Queen!”
“Yes,” said the wife, “now I am the Queen.”

article_info.previous: 渔夫和妻子住在海边一个破败的小屋靠打渔为生。一天渔夫钓到一条鱼，原来是中了魔法的王子。渔夫的妻子知道以后，让渔夫去向鱼索要小别墅作为报酬，鱼满足了她的要求。尝到甜头的妻子贪心不足，又让渔夫去索要城堡。

question.en: Did the fisherman want to be a king?

analysis: 文中提到：“Now, wife,” said the man, “what should I be a king for? I don’t want to be a king.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 当渔夫得知他的妻子必须要做女王时，感受如何？
question.en: How did the fisherman feel when his wife said that she must be the Queen?

analysis: 文中提到：“So the man went, very much upset that his wife should want to be Queen.”因此答案选C。

question.en: How did the sea water change?

options.cn: 海水变得越来越灰暗和汹涌。
options.en: It became darker and more turbulent.

analysis: 由原文可知，渔夫每次提出新的愿望，海水就更浑浊灰暗，汹涌狂暴，因此答案选B。
